header_summary: Olaoluwa Osuntokun expresses gratitude to Antoine Riard for diligent reporting and discusses performance regressions in lnd. Alicexbt discusses wallet fingerprinting in Bitcoin transactions and proposes solutions for privacy. ZmnSCPxj proposes using Scriptless Script BitVM to replace hashes and preimages. Antoine Riard highlights a new attack on lightning channels, and Carla Kirk-Cohen introduces SimLN, a tool for simulating random payment activity on test lightning network setups. Gijs van Dam discusses a concept related to decorrelated payments.

recent_posts.title: Full Disclosure: CVE-2023-40231 / CVE-2023-40232 / CVE-2023-40233 / CVE-2023-40234 "All your mempool are belong to us"
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender expresses gratitude to Antoine for a write-up and diligent reporting.
- All relevant mitigations for lnd were implemented in lnd v0.16.1-beta on April 24th, 2023.
- Performance regressions related to mempool watching have been fixed in version 0.17.1.

recent_posts.title: Goldfish: Spoofing wallet fingerprints to improve privacy
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses wallet fingerprinting in Bitcoin transactions, summarizing previous research and solutions.
- The sender mentions their own blog post on wallet fingerprinting and categorizes different fingerprints.
- They suggest spoofing wallet fingerprints as a solution to enhance privacy and make analysis challenging.

recent_posts.title: BitVM: Compute Anything on Bitcoin
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj suggests using Scriptless Script BitVM to replace hashes and preimages with points and scalars.
- They propose a method for equivocating bit commitments using public keys and MuSig.
- The writer questions the approach's usefulness and suggests simplifying the process by eliminating Tapleaves.

recent_posts.title: Full Disclosure: CVE-2023-40231 / CVE-2023-40232 / CVE-2023-40233 / CVE-2023-40234 "All your mempool are belong to us"
recent_posts.summary:
- A new attack on lightning channels, called the replacement cycling attack, poses security risks.
- Mitigations have been implemented, but bitcoin applications using timelocks or multi-party transactions could still be affected.
- Developers and operators should investigate potential disruptions and assess vulnerabilities caused by these attacks.

recent_posts.title: SimLN: Simulate active test networks
recent_posts.summary:
- SimLN is a tool that simulates random payment activity on any test lightning network setup.
- It facilitates testing applications and proposals on actively processing payment networks.
- SimLN automates payment generation, integrates easily into existing environments, and offers NPC background noise.

recent_posts.title: Payment Splitting & Switching and its impact on Balance Discovery Attacks (preprint)
recent_posts.summary:
- Gijs van Dam and Tony Giorgio are discussing a concept related to decorrelated payments.
- Gijs mentions that the concept could assist with decorrelated payments on an amount analysis level.
- Gijs refers to the concept as a step up after PTLC's and additional timing analysis protections.

active_posts.title: Refreshed BIP324
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal for a new bitcoin P2P protocol with encryption and bandwidth reduction is refreshed.
- Community members invited to review BIP and Bitcoin Core code with multiple updates.
- The proposal includes features like encoding for pubkeys, transport versioning, and traffic shapability.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the challenge of scaling Lightning for casual users using covenants.
- Simple covenants and timeout-trees can eliminate the need for user signatures and improve scalability.
- Off-chain transactions and covenants can make Lightning a widely-used means of payment.

active_posts.title: Solving CoinPool high-interactivity issue with cut-through update of Taproot leaves
active_posts.summary:
- The issue of interactivity constraints in payment pools and channel factories is discussed.
- Proposed solutions include introducing a coordinator or partitioning balances among off-chain users.
- To address interactivity issues, a solution involves preventing off-chain group equivocation using cut-through spends.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The email proposes enabling simple covenants to overcome the scalability challenge of Lightning channels.
- Timeout-trees can be used to address the problem of draining funds and facilitate rollovers.
- Implementing protocols like CTV or APO could make Lightning a widely-used means of payment.

active_posts.title: Practical PTLCs, a little more concretely
active_posts.summary:
- Greg's email emphasizes the significance of PTLCs as taproot channels are nearing deployment.
- Greg shares a GitHub link (https://gist.github.com/instagibbs/1d02d0251640c250ceea1c66665ec163) providing in-depth information on PTLCs.
- He examines message structures and choices, aiming to enhance payment reliability and compatibility with future updates.

active_posts.title: Sidepools For Improving Payment Reliability At Scale
active_posts.summary:
- The sender discusses the difficulty of predicting liquidity allocation on the Lightning Network.
- They propose the use of sidepools to manage fund allocation without closing channels.
- Sidepools help maintain liquidity, preserve privacy, and mitigate liquidity fluctuations during large buyer movements.
